intro: Senecio lawalreeanus, commonly known as the Cape Verde senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and coastal environments. It features narrow, blue-green leaves and produces small yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
